docs.title: GoJelastic (Experimental)
docs.text: An Alternative CLI for Jelastic in Go

docs.title: Why rewrite the CLI in Go?
docs.text:
The official Jelastic command-line interface (CLI) is written in Java, which can make it heavy and inconvenient to use in continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) environments.

Rewriting the CLI in Go will make it lighter and more portable, allowing it to be easily incorporated into CI/CD pipelines and used on a variety of systems without the need for additional dependencies.

This will make it easier for developers to manage and deploy applications on Jelastic, improving efficiency and streamlining the development process.

docs.title: From binary
docs.text:
• Linux/Darwin
# With wget
wget -qO- https://raw.githubusercontent.com/yoanbernabeu/GoJelastic/main/install.sh | bash

# With curl
curl -sL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/yoanbernabeu/GoJelastic/main/install.sh | bash
  • Other Operating Systems

Please download the binary from the release page and move it to your PATH.

docs.title: From source
docs.text:
GoJelastic is written in Go, so you need to install it first.

git clone git@github.com:yoanbernabeu/GoJelastic.git
cd GoJelastic
go build -o GoJelastic

docs.title: Documentation
docs.text: Please check the documentation for more information.

docs.title: License
docs.text: MIT

docs.title: Contributing
docs.text: Pull requests are welcome. For major changes, please open an issue first to discuss what you would like to change.

docs.title: GoJelastic
docs.text: An Alternative CLI for Jelastic

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text: An Alternative and not official CLI for Jelastic

docs.title: Options
docs.text:
-h, --help           help for GoJelastic
  -t, --toggle         Help message for toggle
      --token string   A token is required
      --url string     A url is required

docs.title: SEE ALSO
docs.text:
• GoJelastic completion - Generate the autocompletion script for the specified shell
  • GoJelastic configure - Configure your CLI
  • GoJelastic documentation - Generate documentation

  • GoJelastic getContainerEnvVars - Gets env vars of container
  • GoJelastic getEnv - Gets the full information about environment
  • GoJelastic getEnvs - Gets the information about all environments of a user
  • GoJelastic getExtendedAccountBillingHistoryByPeriod - Gets extended account billing history by period
  • GoJelastic getGroups - Get group list
  • GoJelastic getList - Get list of an environment
  • GoJelastic getNodeGroups - Gets node group's data.
  • GoJelastic getRegions - Gets available regions for the user
  • GoJelastic getRules - Provides information about firewall rules for the environment
  • GoJelastic getUserInfo - Gets information about the user.
  • GoJelastic install - Installs a custom JPS manifest.
  • GoJelastic recoverPassword - Sends an email with the link to reset the account password
  • GoJelastic redeployContainerById - Redeploy a container by id
  • GoJelastic startEnv - Start one environment
  • GoJelastic stopEnv - Stop one environment
  • GoJelastic swapExtIps - Swaps external IP addresses between source and target nodes

docs.title: completion
docs.text: Generate the autocompletion script for the specified shell

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text: Generate the autocompletion script for GoJelastic for the specified shell. See each sub-command's help for details on how to use the generated script.

docs.title: Options
docs.text: -h, --help   help for completion

docs.title: Options inherited from parent commands
docs.text:
--token string   A token is required
      --url string     A url is required

docs.title: SEE ALSO
docs.text:
• GoJelastic - An Alternative CLI for Jelastic
  • GoJelastic completion bash - Generate the autocompletion script for bash
  • GoJelastic completion fish - Generate the autocompletion script for fish
  • GoJelastic completion powershell - Generate the autocompletion script for powershell
  • GoJelastic completion zsh - Generate the autocompletion script for zsh

docs.title: completion bash
docs.text: Generate the autocompletion script for bash

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
Generate the autocompletion script for the bash shell.

This script depends on the 'bash-completion' package. If it is not installed already, you can install it via your OS's package manager.

To load completions in your current shell session:

source <(GoJelastic completion bash)

To load completions for every new session, execute once:

docs.title: Linux:
docs.text: GoJelastic completion bash > /etc/bash_completion.d/GoJelastic

docs.title: macOS:
docs.text:
GoJelastic completion bash > $(brew --prefix)/etc/bash_completion.d/GoJelastic

You will need to start a new shell for this setup to take effect.

GoJelastic completion bash

docs.title: Options
docs.text:
-h, --help              help for bash
      --no-descriptions   disable completion descriptions

docs.title: Options inherited from parent commands
docs.text:
--token string   A token is required
      --url string     A url is required

docs.title: SEE ALSO
docs.text: • GoJelastic completion - Generate the autocompletion script for the specified shell

docs.title: completion fish
docs.text: Generate the autocompletion script for fish

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
Generate the autocompletion script for the fish shell.

To load completions in your current shell session:

GoJelastic completion fish | source

To load completions for every new session, execute once:

GoJelastic completion fish > ~/.config/fish/completions/GoJelastic.fish

You will need to start a new shell for this setup to take effect.

GoJelastic completion fish [flags]

docs.title: Options
docs.text:
-h, --help              help for fish
      --no-descriptions   disable completion descriptions

docs.title: Options inherited from parent commands
docs.text:
--token string   A token is required
      --url string     A url is required

docs.title: SEE ALSO
docs.text: • GoJelastic completion - Generate the autocompletion script for the specified shell

docs.title: completion powershell
docs.text: Generate the autocompletion script for powershell

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
Generate the autocompletion script for powershell.

To load completions in your current shell session:

GoJelastic completion powershell | Out-String | Invoke-Expression

To load completions for every new session, add the output of the above command to your powershell profile.

GoJelastic completion powershell [flags]

docs.title: Options
docs.text:
-h, --help              help for powershell
      --no-descriptions   disable completion descriptions

docs.title: Options inherited from parent commands
docs.text:
--token string   A token is required
      --url string     A url is required

docs.title: SEE ALSO
docs.text: • GoJelastic completion - Generate the autocompletion script for the specified shell

docs.title: completion zsh
docs.text: Generate the autocompletion script for zsh

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
Generate the autocompletion script for the zsh shell.

If shell completion is not already enabled in your environment you will need to enable it. You can execute the following once:

echo "autoload -U compinit; compinit" >> ~/.zshrc

To load completions in your current shell session:

source <(GoJelastic completion zsh); compdef _GoJelastic GoJelastic

To load completions for every new session, execute once:

docs.title: Linux:
docs.text: GoJelastic completion zsh > "${fpath[1]}/_GoJelastic"

docs.title: macOS:
docs.text:
GoJelastic completion zsh > $(brew --prefix)/share/zsh/site-functions/_GoJelastic

You will need to start a new shell for this setup to take effect.

GoJelastic completion zsh [flags]

docs.title: Options
docs.text:
-h, --help              help for zsh
      --no-descriptions   disable completion descriptions

docs.title: Options inherited from parent commands
docs.text:
--token string   A token is required
      --url string     A url is required

docs.title: SEE ALSO
docs.text: • GoJelastic completion - Generate the autocompletion script for the specified shell

docs.title: swapExtIps
docs.text: Swaps external IP addresses between source and target nodes

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
Swaps external IP addresses between source and target nodes (just moves IP if the target node does not have one).

GoJelastic swapExtIps [flags]

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: GoJelastic swapExtIps --token=token --url=url --envName=envName --sourceNodeId=sourceNodeId --targetNodeId=targetNodeId

docs.title: Options
docs.text:
--envName string        An envName is required
  -h, --help                  help for swapExtIps
      --sourceNodeId string   An sourceNodeId is required
      --targetNodeId string   An targetNodeId is required

docs.title: Options inherited from parent commands
docs.text:

      --url string     A url is required
